This is a term that describes everything that happens while user is on a mobility plan. There are two types of activities defined: trips and transactions.

trans-unit.id: Get updated ETAs while you're on a trip by reporting you current location back to our servers. This also helps improve our travel time prediction. We may share this data with our partners who help us make those predictions.

trans-unit.id: Help improve transport services in your area by allowing us to collect information about which trips you select in the app. We aggregate the anomymised data and provide it to researchers, regulators, and transport providers.

This indicate when a user joins a mobility plan. Example: Joined on 1st of Sept. 2019.
Title
Button to show a map or to modify the map's settings

This is a type of mobility bundle. It usually means users have to pay the amount specified to access the benefits included in the bundle. The difference between this and the Subscription type is the fees paid can be used on travel.

This is a type of mobility bundle. It usually means users have to pay some fees per month to access the benefits included in the bundle. The difference between this and the minimum purchase type is the fees paid cannot be used on any travel.

Format string for displaying the discount user received for a trip. The discount is specified as a percentage. An example: Take 5% off every trip Format string for displaying the discount user received for a trip. The discount is specified in the dollar term (as opposed to a percentage). An example: Take $5 off every trip
Button to take a photo
Indicating an action that leads users to pick their home locations. If translation would be too too long, then 'home' can be omitted as it can be inferred from context.
Indicating an action that leads users to pick their work locations. If translation would be too too long, then 'home' can be omitted as it can be inferred from context.

Every weekday in context of repetitions (especially recurring events)
Every weekend day in context of repetitions (especially recurring events)

trans-unit.id: You need to agree to the booking terms and conditions.
trans-unit.source: You need to agree to the booking terms and conditions.
trans-unit.target: Você precisa concordar com os termos de condições de reserva.
trans-unit.note: Message that informs users that T&C must be agreed before booking can be made.

trans-unit.id: You need to agree to the insurance terms and conditions.
trans-unit.source: You need to agree to the insurance terms and conditions.
trans-unit.target: Voce precisa concordar com os termos de condições e seguro.
trans-unit.note: Message that informs users that T&C for insurance must be agreed before booking can be made.

trans-unit.id: You previously denied this app access to your calendar. Please go to the Settings app > Privacy > Calendar and authorise this app to use this feature.
trans-unit.source: You previously denied this app access to your calendar. Please go to the Settings app > Privacy > Calendar and authorise this app to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: Voce anteriormente negou o acesso deste app ao seu calendário. Por favor, acione Configurações > Privacidade> Calendário e autorizar este aplicativo para usar este recurso.
trans-unit.note: Calendar authorisation needed text

trans-unit.id: You previously denied this app access to your contacts. Please go to the Settings app > Privacy > Contacts and authorise this app to use this feature.
trans-unit.source: You previously denied this app access to your contacts. Please go to the Settings app > Privacy > Contacts and authorise this app to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: Você anteriormente negou o acesso desse aplicativo aos seus contatos. Por favor, acione configurações de aplicativos > Privacidade > Contatos e autorizar este aplicativo para usar este recurso.
trans-unit.note: Contacts authorisation needed text
Indicator that an event is all-day, or that something is open all-day

Estimated time of departure; parameter is time, e.g., 'departs 15:30'

to %date. (old key: DateToFormat)

trans-unit.id: userToken is missing in the server response
trans-unit.source: userToken is missing in the server response
trans-unit.target: userToken is missing in the server response
trans-unit.note: Error message when our server fails to return userToken in response to a sign in or sign up request
Format for a service's real-time indicator for a service which is early, e.g., '1 min early. This means #1 is replaced with something like '1 min'.

Format for a service's real-time indicator for a service which is early, e.g., '1 min early (1:10 pm service). This means #1 is replaced with something like '1 min' and #2 is replaced with the original time, e.g., '1:10 pm').
Format for a service's real-time indicator for a service which is late, e.g., '1 min late. This means #1 is replaced with something like '1 min'

Format for a service's real-time indicator for a service which is late, e.g., '1 min late (1:10 pm service). This means #1 is replaced with something like '1 min' and #2 is replaced with the original time, e.g., '1:10 pm').
Title for something that happened a certain timeframe ago, e.g., '5 mins ago'
Number of alerts, in this case, there are multiple (plural)
Filler for a specific service running at a time, e.g., '396 at 11:56am'
Indicator for how cycle-friendly a cycling route is. Placeholder will get replaced with '75%'.
Filler for a specific frequency-based service indicating its frequency, e.g., 'M10 every 10 minutes'
Text for an 'x more' indication if there's more content. '%@' will be replaced with a number
Number of stops before you get off a vehicle, if there are 2 stops or more, e.g., '10 stops'. (old key: Stops)
Duration without traffic
Indicator for how wheelchair-friendly a wheeelchair route is. Placeholder will get replaced with '75%'.
Number of alerts, in this case, there is just one
Number of stops before you get off a stop, if there's just 1 stop.
No comment provided by engineer.

The first '%@' will be replaced with the place of arrival, the second with the time. (old key: ArrivalLocationTime)

Used when the trip does not end at the requested location, but nearby. The '%@' will be replaced with requested destination location.
